- Prefer Julia standard libraries, avoid new packages unless explicitly requested.

# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

```julia
using Printf
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    lines = []
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(line) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

@printf("This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped.")
```
Note: The function uses the `@printf` macro from the `Printf` standard library to format the string. The macro takes a format string and any number of arguments, and returns a formatted string. In this case, we are using it to wrap the input string at the specified width.
